description: The surprise appeal comes as Pope Francis considers an easing of the rule banning married priests.
title: Retired Pope Benedict warns Francis against relaxing priestly celibacy rules
title_page: Retired Pope Benedict warns Francis against relaxing priestly celibacy rules - BBC News
maintext: This is also a collision between the ancient belief that celibacy is exemplified in the life of Christ and the ministry of Apostle Paul, who wrote in his First Epistle to the Corinthians that "I wish all people were like me", and the demands of a modern church that is growing across the Amazon region but where there is a severe shortage of priests.
